  • Method Details

    • initNextId

      private void initNextId() throws SerializerWasNotCreated
      Initializes the next id by searching through the saved records finding the one with the maximum id value and then setting the nextID field to that value + 1
      Throws:
      SerializerWasNotCreated - if an IO or serialization error occured

    • createSaveFile

      private void createSaveFile() throws SerializerWasNotCreated
      Creates a save file if it did not exist yet.
      Throws:
      SerializerWasNotCreated - if an IO error Occured

    • getFilePath

      public String getFilePath()

    • getNextId

      public long getNextId()

    • appendNewData

      public void appendNewData(T t) throws SerializerCannotRead, SerializerCannotWrite
      Adds a new record to the save file.

      nextID will be automatically increased in the process.

      Parameters:
      t - the record that will be added to the save file
      Throws:
      SerializerCannotRead - if the function can't open the old records
      SerializerCannotWrite - if the function can't write the modified record set

    • readAll

      public List<T> readAll() throws SerializerCannotRead
      Returns the existing records in a List
      Returns:
      a List of the existing records
      Throws:
      SerializerCannotRead - if an IO Error occured or the records could not be serialized

    • changeData

      public void changeData(T t) throws SerializerCannotRead, SerializerCannotWrite
      Changes a data record in the save files

      Old and new records will be compared by their ids

      Parameters:
      t - the data record with the new parameters (Id must match with the old records id)
      Throws:
      SerializerCannotRead - if the function can't open the old records
      SerializerCannotWrite - if the function can't write the modified record set

    • removeData

      public void removeData(long id) throws SerializerCannotRead, SerializerCannotWrite
      Removes a record with a specified id from the save file
      Parameters:
      id - the id of the record that will be removed
      Throws:
      SerializerCannotRead - if the function can't open the old records
      SerializerCannotWrite - if the function can't write the modified record set

    • write

      private void write(List<T> datas) throws SerializerCannotWrite
      Writes out a list of data to the save file
      Parameters:
      datas - List of data that will be written
      Throws:
      SerializerCannotWrite - if writing the data failed

    • findId

      public long findId(T data, Comparator<T> comparator) throws SerializerCannotRead, IdNotFoundException
      Finds and returns the id of the first record using a comparator
      Parameters:
      data - the data the records will be compared with
      comparator - the comparator method
      Returns:
      the id of the first record where the comparator found a match
      Throws:
      SerializerCannotRead - if the function can't open the old records
      IdNotFoundException - if the id was not found by the comparator

    • recordsSize

      public int recordsSize() throws SerializerCannotRead
      Returns the number records are in the save file.
      Returns:
      number of records in the save file.
      Throws:
      SerializerCannotRead - if the records could not be read
